channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 重大新闻：唐纳德-特朗普的封口费案将于 4 月 15 日开庭。法官驳回了前总统要求撤诉的请求。
item.description:
Breaking: Donald Trump's hush money trial is set to begin April 15. A judge declined the former president's bid to dismiss the case. https://t.co/qV4sFzZMMH https://t.co/qV4sFzZMMH

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：乔恩-德克尔（Jon Decker）写道，四天工作制、混合日程表、远程工作和 "打工经济 "的日益普及表明，伯尼-桑德斯的法案并不激进，而是多余和不必要的。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The growing availability of four-day workweeks, hybrid schedules, remote work and the gig economy reveals that Bernie Sanders’s bill isn’t radical as much as it is superfluous and unnecessary, writes Jon Decker https://t.co/4kdsQv3bBf

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 电视传奇人物鲍勃-巴克（Bob Barker）长期居住的好莱坞住宅即将上市，售价为 298.8 万美元。巴克在这所约 5000 平方英尺的房子里居住了 50 多年。
item.description:
The longtime Hollywood home of TV legend Bob Barker is coming on the market for $2.988 million. Barker lived in the roughly 5,000-square-foot house for more than 50 years. https://t.co/AfJOfjFjU8 https://t.co/AfJOfjFjU8

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 最新消息纽约州上诉法院裁定，唐纳德-特朗普只需承担其 4.54 亿美元民事欺诈判决中的 1.75 亿美元，同时对全额判决提出上诉。
item.description:
Breaking: Donald Trump will only need to pony up $175 million of his $454 million civil-fraud judgment while he appeals the full amount, a New York state appellate court ruled https://t.co/4j6iFdDBej https://t.co/4j6iFdDBej

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）苦苦挣扎的社交媒体平台将于周二登陆股市，这凸显了该公司业绩疲软与其高价股票之间的反差。
item.description:
Donald Trump’s struggling social-media platform will hit the stock market Tuesday, highlighting the contrast between the company’s weak performance and its pricey stock https://t.co/cNE5ZbwGU1 https://t.co/cNE5ZbwGU1

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

Tech moguls have traded hoodies for conventional styles—dressing down "is so played out" https://t.co/80QQuPnEki https://t.co/80QQuPnEki

item.title: 悉尼-斯威尼（Sydney Sweeney）在不工作的时候会尽量减少美容程序。"我要么只用腮红和睫毛膏，要么什么都不用"。
item.description:
Sydney Sweeney keeps her beauty routine minimal when she’s not working. “I’m either a blush-and-mascara kind of girl or nothing at all.” https://t.co/a4G1Rzjqf0 https://t.co/a4G1Rzjqf0

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 你的 401（k）能为你的退休生活带来什么？四位单身女性公开自己的财务状况。

What does your 401(k) buy you in retirement? Four single women open up about their finances. https://t.co/nwKhsB7OUX https://t.co/nwKhsB7OUX

item.title: "财富管理公司 Osaic 的首席市场策略师菲尔-布兰卡托（Phil Blancato）说："今天的美国储蓄者正在获胜，利率保持在较高水平的时间越长，对他们越有利。
item.description:
“The American saver today is winning, and the longer interest rates stay higher the better it is for them,” says Phil Blancato, chief market strategist for wealth management company Osaic. https://t.co/3IhsymVlws

— Buy Side from WSJ (@BuySideWSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: MSNBC 的乔-斯卡伯勒（Joe Scarborough）和米卡-布热津斯基（Mika Brzezinski）表示，他们强烈反对 NBC 新闻台聘用前共和党全国委员会主席罗娜-麦克丹尼尔（Ronna McDaniel），称其为 "反民主选举的否认者"。
item.description:
MSNBC’s Joe Scarborough and Mika Brzezinski said they strongly objected to NBC News’s hiring of former Republican National Committee Chairwoman Ronna McDaniel, whom they called an “anti-democracy election denier.” https://t.co/HDWw2RFCEO https://t.co/HDWw2RFCEO

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 这是一个长期以来为众多政客所追捧的流行观点：给教师加薪。然而，几十年来一直没有实现。现在，一些立法者正在倡导新的加薪规定，以强制解决这一问题。
item.description:
It is a popular idea long embraced by an array of politicians: Give teachers a raise. Yet it hasn’t happened in decades. Now, some lawmakers are championing new pay mandates to force the issue. https://t.co/7f9nI7W9se https://t.co/7f9nI7W9se

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 麦肯锡、波士顿咨询公司（BCG）和德勤（Deloitte）等老牌大型咨询公司受雇为全球最大的企业预测未来，但它们却弄错了自己的命运--其后果是一团糟
item.description:
Big and established consulting firms such as McKinsey, BCG and Deloitte, which are paid to predict the future for the world’s biggest corporations, have gotten their own destiny wrong—and the fallout is messy https://t.co/Mg0zmLNOos https://t.co/Mg0zmLNOos

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 超级通勤者需要大量的金钱、里程数和耐力。以下是《华尔街日报》的一位记者如何从俄亥俄州的家中前往纽约工作。
item.description:
Being a supercommuter takes a lot of money, miles and stamina. Here's how a WSJ reporter has been traveling to work in New York City from his home in Ohio. https://t.co/t14zZncV1x https://t.co/t14zZncV1x

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 爱立信计划在瑞典裁员约 1200 人，以适应产量下降的环境。以下是今年迄今为止宣布裁员的一些公司。
item.description:
Ericsson plans to cut around 1,200 jobs in Sweden as it adjusts to a lower-volume environment.

Here’s a look at some of the companies that have announced layoffs so far this year. https://t.co/UXWRfrBT3p https://t.co/UXWRfrBT3p

item.title: 与贝克-麦坚时合作的付费项目：随着地缘政治紧张局势加剧和监管审查加强，国际并购正变得越来越复杂。如何让交易步入正轨？
item.description:
Paid Program with Baker McKenzie: International M&A is becoming more complex amid increased geopolitical tension and greater regulatory scrutiny. Here's how to keep deals on track.https://t.co/bCE3V5akbi

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：这不是正确的 "疯狂三月"。各大学已经推迟了录取截止日期，以便学生有更多时间比较经济补助金，而且截止日期可能会再次延长。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: This isn’t the right kind of March madness. Colleges have already pushed back acceptance deadlines so students have more time to compare financial-aid awards, and they could be extended again. https://t.co/jvHAPVmvjI

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 斡旋大会能否取代拜登总统？历史学家爱德华-阿乔恩（Edward Achorn）写道，历史表明这将非常困难，但并非不可能。
item.description:
Could a brokered convention replace President Biden? History suggests that it would be very difficult—but not impossible, writes historian Edward Achorn. https://t.co/WDictygKPS https://t.co/WDictygKPS

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 医生说，这种治疗方法并不总能阻止癌症复发，但确实能增加治愈的几率
item.description:
Doctors say this course of treatment doesn’t always stop cancer from coming back, but it does increase the odds of cure https://t.co/OBFWiUx6gi https://t.co/OBFWiUx6gi

item.title: 周一，加密货币大亨权斗（Do Kwon）将出庭受审，他被指控诈骗了购买两年前崩盘的加密货币的人。他不会出庭。
item.description:
Fallen crypto tycoon Do Kwon faces trial Monday on claims that he defrauded people who bought a cryptocurrency that collapsed two years ago. He won’t be there. https://t.co/an4J1xzob6 https://t.co/an4J1xzob6

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 他曾是一名律师，生活在美国梦中。后来，精神疾病让他的聪明才智与自己背道而驰。"他的姐姐说："我们以为他会得到他需要的帮助。相反，他失去了一切。
item.description:
He was a lawyer living the American dream. Then mental illness turned his brilliant mind against him. “We thought he was going to get the help he needed,” his sister said. Instead, he lost it all. https://t.co/SM48VWuiAR https://t.co/SM48VWuiAR

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 25, 2024

item.title: 今年 NCAA 锦标赛中的明星球员并不是那些即将进入 NBA 的青少年球员。相反，他们是球场上最年长的球员。
